titleStmt.title: Treason in Ireland for the blowing up of the Kings English forces with a hundred barrells of gun-powder; with the names of the chiefe agents; and the manner of the discovery, December the tenth. VVith a relation of the crueltie of the Irish rebels used against the English Protestants there, killing them, ravishing the women, cutting them to pieces, ... With two battels fought betwixt the Protestants and the Rebels: the Rebels having the worst in both. With a plot discovered at Athigh. Sent into England by Mr [sic] Hierome, Minister of Gods Word at Athigh in Ireland.
titleStmt.author: Jerome, Stephen, fl. 1604-1650.

notesStmt.note: With a woodcut illustration of the battle on A4v.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library, Oxford.
